original: 5.3 Pariññāvāra🔽5.3.3. Anāgatavāra🔽Yo dukkhasaccaṁ parijānissati so samudayasaccaṁ pajahissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: pariññāvāra  anāgatavāra  yaḥ dukkha saccam parijānissati saḥ samudaya saccam pajahissati iti āmantā
translated: The Chapter on Full-Understanding🔽… The Future🔽“Will the one who will fully understand the truth of suffering abandon the truth of the origin?” “Yes.”

original: Yo vā pana …pe… ? Āmantā.🔽Yo dukkhasaccaṁ na parijānissati so samudayasaccaṁ nappajahissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana pe  yaḥ dukkha saccam na parijānissati saḥ samudaya saccam na ppajahissati iti āmantā
translated: “Or the one who will abandon the truth of origin fully understand the truth of suffering?” “Yes.”🔽“The one who will not fully understand the truth of suffering will not abandon the truth of origin?” “Yes.”🔽“Or the one who will not abandon the truth of origin will not fully understand the truth of suffering?” “Yes.”
Or, if a monk, after being invited, should ask for fresh or cooked food for himself, except at the proper time, it entails suspension.
